args:
It turns out that Emile's condition and the spirits
were unrelated—and denied by Emile, the
ghosts sadly depart. But with the matter settled,
the head butler attempts to make everyone stay
on, forcing the trio to make a break for it!
I'm gonna finish this right now!\nSUPER DUPER ADORBS DEVOTION BEAM!
Are you quite unhurt, Emperor Emile?!
Is he well again? The servants' technique\nought to have exorcised the ghosts, yes?

Yes, and I suspect he should be returned to
his usual self and ready to lob a complaint
or three at us for having given him so solid
a drubbing.
You seem to have exhausted great efforts,\nand I must applaud your devotion.
If I have done something that troubles you,\nspeak it plain. As emperor, I shall hear\nand accept all you have to say.
Such terribly calmed eyes... Is purging\nhim of this evil spirit truly beyond us?
It is much too soon for giving up!\nIf once we should fail, then twice,\nthrice, and onward must we climb!
Foul ghost, begone from Emperor Emile!\nHaaaah!
Something flew out of Emile's hand!\nUm, hang on. It's...a book?

＂Royals Are from Mars, Subjects Are
from Venus: What to Say to Make Your
Subordinates Love You.＂ ...Okay, what
the hey is THIS?!
GYA! My book of wisdom! You people\nsaw inside my sacred book of wisdom!
Ah. Upon close inspection, the desktop is\nloaded with similar books of wisdom—\nwhich is to say, self-improvement tomes.

＂Wise, Witty Words: Famous Sayings of
Wonderful Rulers throughout the Ages.＂
No, these most certainly do not appear
to be foul spellbooks.
Don't look at them, I tell you—and stop\nreading the titles aloud or my brilliant\nstrategy will all come to ruin!
What brilliant strategy is this, Emperor?
Ugh! Can't you tell just by looking around?\nI'm memorizing wise sayings so everyone\nwill respect me as a ruler!

What, you have a problem with that?
Lately I've been entrusting governing to the
people, which has boosted both the
imperial capital's and my own reputation.

Thus, those beneath me have begun to
shower me with praise. It feels good to be
so adored, so I hoped to show an even
better side of myself and keep it going.
This is why I had set my focus utterly\non studying hard. Admirable, no?
I do think it admirable...\nThough I'm more impressed with just\nhow blatantly ＂Emile＂ your motive is.

It IS impressive, isn't it?! I've stayed up
from dusk to dawn and devoted myself
to burning the midnight candle in efforts
to better myself.
Though it's a bit unfortunate the goal\nyou settled on was the rote memorization\nof wise maxims...
Soooo I guess Emile just shut himself up\nin the basement so he could...read?

The strange ＂spells＂ we heard were merely
his reading self-help books aloud, and the
＂wise ruler＂ aura he gave off was an act
cribbed wholly from said books.

And he likely drove off his subordinates
because he did not wish them to see him
attempting such. But on a related note,
why did you halt your artistic pursuits?
Because I made a deal with the heavens to\nquit my art so my studies would go well!\n...As one does.
Well, I guess it's good Emile hasn't\nactually been haunted this whole time.
Those ghosts! The ones who keep saying\n＂friend＂ and stuff like that.
There's nothing there at all. You mustn't\ntell strange lies, even if you are a child.
Er, I'm afraid there are ghosts, sir.\nThey surround you even now.
As far as I can see, they are insisting upon\na party with their friend, Emperor Emile.
It's utter nonsense! Do you hear me?!\nIf you can't see it, it's not there—\nand I can't see it SO IT'S NOT!
Okay, now I think you're legitimately\nstarting to traumatize them.
Can you truly not see these most pitiful\nof beings, Emperor Emile?
No, because there's NO SUCH THING!
Hmm. Forgive us, spirits, but he appears\nto have no ability to perceive the\nsupernatural whatsoever.
BOOOOOO HOOO HOOO! WE WERE SO\nHAPPY THAT EMILE WAS STAYING IN THE\nBASEMENT ALL THIS TIME!
HE NEVER GOT MAD NO MATTER\nHOW MUCH ENERGY WE TOOK.\nHE WAS SUCH A NICE FRIEND!
BUT IT WAS JUST BECAUSE HE COULDN'T\nSEE US! HE TOYED WITH OUR HEARTS!\n...THIS PARTY IS OVER.
Look! All the ghosts went away!
It seems their sadness at being rejected\nby Emile ran deeper than we suspected.
He actually made them cry. Remarkable...
Don't talk about me like I did\nsomething wrong here!
In any event, it would seem our mystery\nis finally at an end.
The basement Emile employed in his\nintensive study was a habitat for ghosts.
They grew in power as they absorbed\nvitality from Emile, and possessed the\nhead butler.
As a result, no one was able to purge the\nspirits until our arrival.
And now we can return to the Halidom.\nA fine job, one and all.
Um, yeah. We only came here to check on\nEmile, and since he's fine, we're going.
Your suitability as servants is the highest\nI've seen in years! You're perfect! \nThe idea of you leaving is OUTRAGEOUS!
I have finally found the exceptional\nservants I need to take care of Emperor\nEmile, and I cannot permit you to go.
But I have a recital to get to!\n...Emile! Do something!
Hmph! Don't look at me. Right now, I'm\nfeeling depressed that my plan to become\nan even more beloved ruler failed.

ALSO, you leveled groundless suspicions
upon me! You should feel bad and want to
make it up to me! Don't let them get away,
Higgins!
What the blazes is that aura?!
That is the ultimate servants' technique:\none used by truly brilliant servants which\nunleashes the full power of their love...
Should we bear the brunt of it, we will find\nescape a difficult proposition indeed.
I must teach you the final techniques.
They are techniques absolutely necessary\nso long as we serve in this manor.\nAnd they are...

The wisdom to turn a blind eye to one's
master's embarrassments, and the
fleetness of foot needed to flee in case
you fail to do so!
We turn to that oldest and sagest of\nlast resorts: a speedy retreat.
Release everything that you have\ncultivated in your training as servants,\nand abandon this place with all speed!
NOW FLY, YOU FOOLS!\nFLY LIKE THE WIND!
You'll not escape! All shall be as\nEmperor Emile wills it!
I did not consider that fleeing might also\nbe part of a servant's work...
It appears I have only just begun\nthe long journey along this path!
